member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.BaseSession
member.summary: A base class for NXOpen session objects

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.BaseSession.evalualuteCallStack(NXOpen.Utilities.ResourceUtilities.SignatureType@)
member.summary: This method evaluates the callstack to detect if we are simply a journal replay or if someone is trying to cheat the licensing system by calling an unsigned .Net dll

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.BaseSession.GetObjectManager
member.summary: Returns an NXOpenManager object instance that can be used to get NX Open objects from tags obtained by calling methods on classes in the NXOpen.UF namespace.
member.returns: An NXOpenManager object that can be used to get NX Open objects from tags.

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.NeedDOTNETAuthorLicenseException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when trying to load a DLL that has not been properly built and signed by the SignLibrary utility.

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.NeedSNAPAuthorLicenseException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when trying to load a DLL that has not been properly built and signed by the SignLibrary utility.

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.NXObjectManager
member.summary: Maintains a mapping between Tags and objects.
member.remarks: This class can be used to help use methods in the NXOpen.UF namespace together with objects in the NXOpen namespace. Use the method to get an object instance of this class.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.NXObjectManager.GetTaggedObject(NXOpen.Tag)
member.summary: Returns the object corresponding to a tag. Use this method in a remoting application.
member.remarks: The object that is returned by this method is unique for given tag while that tag is alive. The Tag property of the object will return the tag with which it was obtained by this method. Methods in classes in the NXOpen.UF namespace may return tags and GetTaggedObject can be used to obtain the corresponding object.
member.param: Tag for which an object is wanted.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.NXObjectManager.Get(NXOpen.Tag)
member.summary: Returns the object corresponding to a tag.
member.remarks: The object that is returned by this method is unique for given tag while that tag is alive. The Tag property of the object will return the tag with which it was obtained by this method. Methods in classes in the NXOpen.UF namespace may return tags and Get can be used to obtain the corresponding object.
member.param: Tag for which an object is wanted.

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotableObject
member.summary: A base class for all NXOpen remotable objects

member.name: P:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotableObject.NextSink
member.summary: Gets the next message sink in the sink chain.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotableObject.SyncProcessMessage(System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage)
member.returns: A reply message in response to the request.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotableObject.AsyncProcessMessage(System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage,System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessageSink)
member.param: The reply sink for the reply message.
member.returns: Returns an IMessageCtrl interface that provides a way to control asynchronous messages after they have been dispatched.

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotingHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods to extend remoting support for new applications to be developed on NX platform.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotingHelper.IsSessionRunningRemotely(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether the session object belongs to another process, i.e. if a remote server object

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.NXRemotingHelper.GetServerObject(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Retrieves the server object for a given type running on the same port that of the owner (NX session) Naming convention "ClassName_ServerObject" should be used while exporting it from server application.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.PeReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance, based on the data from an Assembly DLL. Fetches the security data directory inside the PE Optional header. Throws a InvalidPeFormatException if the assembly has invalid PE format.

member.name: P:NXOpen.Utilities.PeReader.HasSecurityDir
member.summary: Return True if the security data directory has been set; otherwise False

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.PeReader.MarshalBytesTo``1(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads in a block from a file and converts it to the struct type specified by the template parameter

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.InvalidPeFormatException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when PeReader class loads a DLL with invalid Portable Executable (PE) format

members.member: Constructs a new instance, based on the data from an Assembly DLL. Throws a MissingResourceException if the assembly does not contain the appropriate NX resource.
Computes a hashcode from the contents of the assembly.
Gets the embeddedData embedded in the resource block
Returns the release assembly was signed in assuming one is present, otherwise it is unknown when signed
Returns the information on whom signed the assembly
Gets the signature embedded in the resource block
Embeds the given data in the resource block. If the data length is greater than 256 bytes, it is truncated to 256.
Embeds the given signature in the resource block. Note that the embedded data should be set first before calling this method.

member.name: T:NXOpen.Utilities.MissingResourceException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown when trying to load a DLL that has not been properly built and signed by the SignDotNet utility.

member.name: M:NXOpen.Utilities.ScriptHost.AddReferenceItemsForHostApp(System.String)
member.summary: Adds given references for the running application in addition to default references.
member.param: Comma separated list of .net assembly names.

member.name: T:NXOpen.TransientObject
member.summary: A base class for all NXOpen transient objects

member.name: P:NXOpen.TransientObject.Handle
member.summary: Handle of the internal object represented by this object.
member.remarks: This property should not be used by automation programs.

member.name: M:NXOpen.TransientObject.Dispose
member.remarks: After this method is called, it is illegal to use the object. This method is automatically called when the object is deleted by the garbage collector.

member.name: M:NXOpen.TransientObject.ToString
member.summary: Returns a String that represents the current Object.

member.summary: Displays a simple text entry dialog to the user and returns the number the user enters.

remarks.para: Throws a FormatException if the input text does not form a valid number.
Throws an OverflowException if the input text is outside the valid range for doubles.

member.param: Prompt string to the user for the text entry box.
Caption string for the window title to the text entry dialog.
Initial double to use as a default number in the text entry box.

member.name: M:NXOpenUI.NXInputBox.ParseInputNumber(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.IFormatProvider,System.Double@)
member.summary: Displays a simple text entry dialog to the user, parses the string the user enters, and if it is a valid number, sets result to the value the user entered and returns true.

remarks.para: Throws a FormatException if the input text does not form a valid number.
Throws an OverflowException if the input text is outside the valid range for doubles.

member.param: Prompt string to the user for the text entry box.
Caption string for the window title to the text entry dialog.

Initial text to use as default text in the text entry box.
This initial text should form a valid double number.
The permitted format of the input number defined as a combination of one or more System.Globalization.NumberStyles constants.
A format provider that defines the valid culture-specific format for the input number.
An out parameter containing the parsed number input by the user. If the method returns true, result contains a valid double number.

member.name: M:NXOpenUI.NXInputBox.ParseInputNumber(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.IFormatProvider,System.Double@)
member.summary: Displays a simple text entry dialog to the user and returns the string the user enters.

remarks.para: Throws a FormatException if the input text does not form a valid number.
Throws an OverflowException if the input text is outside the valid range for doubles.

member.param: Prompt string to the user for the text entry box.
Caption string for the window title to the text entry dialog.
Initial double to use as a default number in the text entry box.
The permitted format of the input number defined as a combination of one or more System.Globalization.NumberStyles constants.
A format provider that defines the valid culture-specific format for the input number.
An out parameter containing the parsed number input by the user. If the method returns true, result contains a valid double number.
